questions.question_text:
A company employs a team of customer service agents to provide telephone and email support to customers.
The company develops a webchat bot to provide automated answers to common customer queries.
Which business benefit should the company expect as a result of creating the webchat bot solution?

HOTSPOT -
To complete the sentence, select the appropriate option in the answer area.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Reliability and safety: To build trust, it's critical that AI systems operate reliably, safely, and consistently under normal circumstances and in unexpected conditions.
These systems should be able to operate as they were originally designed, respond safely to unanticipated conditions, and resist harmful manipulation.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/responsible-ai-principles/4-guiding-principles

discussion.content:
1. Reliability and safety

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/innovate/best-practices/trusted-ai#reliability-and-safety
AI systems need to be reliable and safe in order to be trusted. It's important for a system to perform as it was originally designed and for it to respond safely to new situations. Its inherent resilience should resist intended or unintended manipulation. Rigorous testing and validation should be established for operating conditions to ensure that the system responds safely to edge cases, and A/B testing and champion/challenger methods should be integrated into the evaluation process.
Reliablity and Safety is correct answer

For me to remember xD

Reliability and Safety = self-driving cars
These "wtk" things are terrible and not fair..
emphasis is on Reliability and safety hence answer is correct
The key here is system resilience during unexpected events, so "reliability and safety" is the correct principle

I took the exam today 8/19/2022.

The QnA has been replaced by "Language Service". I managed to pass the exam with the score of 916/1000.

comments.content: Azure Cognitive Service for Language has been renamed to Azure Language Service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AB is the correct answer from the provided. However, QnA Maker need to changed to "Azure Cognitive Service for Language". Azure Cognitive Service for Language can create question and answer bank that can be join to Bot Service to achieve the goal motioned in the question.

Selected Answer: AB
A and B are correct answers
QnA to be replaced with Language service Custom Question Answering feature

Selected Answer: AB

questions.question_text:
You plan to develop a bot that will enable users to query a knowledge base by using natural language processing.
Which two services should you include in the solution? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

In which two scenarios can you use a speech synthesis solution? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Speech recognition - the ability to detect and interpret spoken input.
Speech synthesis - the ability to generate spoken output.

Selected Answer: AD
A and D is correct
--> https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/text-to-speech

The thing that made me uncertain about A is that if the telephone call did NOT have a reasonable expectation of privacy. If it was on a speaker phone, in public, would the bot reading out your CC number out loud be considered as breaking the principle of Security & Privacy for Responsible AI? 

Maybe I am overthinking it and these exams sometimes really do just want the answer based on the simplest scenario with no extra context.

Text to speech enables your applications, tools, or devices to convert text into humanlike synthesized speech. The text to speech capability is also known as speech synthesis. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/speech-service/text-to-speech

Selected Answer: AD
A and D

choices.D: an AI character in a computer game that speaks audibly to a player
choices.C: extracting key phrases from the audio recording of a meeting
choices.A: an automated voice that reads back a credit card number entered into a telephone by using a numeric keypad
choices.B: generating live captions for a news broadcast

discussion.content:
I just took the exam today 8/19/2022.

The main keywords here Translator service are now replaced by "Language Service". So I got confused on the last question and to my understanding based on the exam, the "language service" covers as a whole (NLP, Speech, QnA Maker, Text service) all related past questions from exam topics. So for this particular question. I answered YYY. 

I still managed to pass the exam with the score of 916/1000.

comments.content:
Translator service still seems to exist: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/translator/translator-overview
But it is true that many services changed names and are aggregated what makes it confusing.

discussion.content: This should be YYY. If you go to the website mentioned in the answer (https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/speech-to-text/#overview) the very first thing the page says is "Quickly and accurately transcribe audio to text in more than 100 languages and variants."

comments.content: How did you corelate Translator service with Speech-To-Text service? Azure AI Translator service is different from Speech service. So it should be YYN

discussion.content: Given answer is correct. to convert audible speech in to text you need speech to text service
Transcribe audio into text is speech recognition hence YYN

This should be correct, because you require Speech first in addition to convert audio to text, see more details here: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/speech-translation/#features

questions.answer_description:
The translator service provides multi-language support for text translation, transliteration, language detection, and dictionaries.
Speech-to-Text, also known as automatic speech recognition (ASR), is a feature of Speech Services that provides transcription.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/Translator/translator-info-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/legal/cognitive-services/speech-service/speech-to-text/transparency-note
